page.title: 04Employment in Helford area
page.content: ON THE LAND There are farmers ,who are self employed, and emloyed farm workers.The number of people working on the land varies considerably because a lot of seasonal work is available at flower picking time,when about 200 females are employed as casual labour.The full time workers on other farms vary between 1 and 6. HAULAGE The haulage contractor at High Lane has 18 lorries and carries roadstone,asphalt,aggregates,cattle, cattle feed and grain, also fertiliser from merchants to farms. FISHING Several local fishermen work from Helford and Bishop's Quay. Other occupations : Motor mechanic, carpenter, hairdresser, boatyard owner, author, publican, work associated with tourist accommodation. Labour relations are excellent.
